page.title: 17HISTORY
page.content: MUCH OF THE IMPORTANCE OF MURSLEY IN THE THIRTEENTH CENTURY IS DUE TO A CHARTER BEING GRANTED TO WARREN AND AGNES FITZGERALD TO HOLD A WEDNESDAY MARKET IN 1242.MURSLEY LIES BETWEEN BUCKINGHAM AND DUNSTABLE AND SO WOULD HAVE BEEN A ROUTE FOR TRAVELLERS ON THEIR WAY TO LONDON.THEY WERE ALSO GRANTED A CHARTER FOR A THREE DAY FAIR TO BE HELD EVERY YEAR ON THE FEAST OF THE VIRGIN MARY(7TH,8TH,9TH SEPTEMBER) THIS FAIR WAS REVIVED IN THE 1950'S BY LOCAL PEOPLE. {SIR JOHN FORTESCUE.}IN 1570 THE MANOR OF SALDEN CAME INTO THE POSSESSION OF SIR JOHN WHO WAS A VERY IMPORTANT GENTLEMAN BEING A RELATION OF QUEEN ELIZABETH 1.HE WAS VERY WEALTHY AND GENEROUS.AFTER ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTY YEARS THE HOUSE WAS DIVIDED AND PARTLY DEMOLISHED IN 1738.THIS HAPPENED AS THERE WERE NO HEIRS STILL LIVING.
